scenario: Agent A, a high school science teacher, is seated at the kitchen table surrounded by cookbooks and notes amidst the aroma of baking bread. Agent B is blending homemade drinks at the counter, and Agent C enters after a morning jog. Agent A's attention is captured by an old box of recipes on a high shelf.

actions.description: Agent A retrieves the recipe box from the shelf and explores its contents.

scenario: Agent A, a 14-year-old, is in the family kitchen with a new cookbook, ready to delve into complex recipes. Agent B, A's parent, is busy at the kitchen table, and Agent C, A's grandparent, tends to the plants. Ingredients are prepped on the counter, casting an inviting scene.

scenario: Agent A has just turned 15 and is exploring their new two-story home with an attic and a neglected garden.

Agent A asks Agent B and Agent C if they have seen a key that fits the description.

Agent A chooses to move boxes around, attempting to find clues or any markings that might reveal more about the home's previous owners.
Agent A starts investigating the garden, pulling out weeds and discovering which plants are salvageable.

Agent A goes online to look up the history of the house or any stories associated with it.
Agent A sets out to disassemble their old bed frame to redesign it to better fit with the aesthetic of their new room.

scenario: Agent A, a university student with an athletic background, is in the kitchen surrounded by cookbooks and exotic ingredients, preparing to cook a traditional dish from an unfamiliar cuisine. Agent B, a high school teacher, and Agent C, a retired nurse, are present in adjacent spaces.

The greenhouse is well-organized, with labeled pots for each plant, a watering system, and a workbench covered with gardening tools and reference books about plants from different climates.

scenario: Agent A, a university student with a range of academic interests, is stationed at a large wooden desk laden with assorted books in the sunlit corner of her shared living room.

scenario: Agent A, an enthusiastic hobbyist gardener, notices an unusual leaf pattern on one of his potted plants and suspects a disease he has read about but never encountered. Agent B, friend and fellow plant enthusiast, is rearranging a bookshelf, while Agent C, Agent A’s teenage cousin, lounges on the couch. Agent A decides to take action by closely examining the plant, seeking information, and involving his friends in the process.
